benchmark_details.name: WebMall
benchmark_details.overview: WebMall is a multi-shop benchmark for evaluating the effectiveness and efficiency of web agents for comparison-shopping. It consists of four simulated online shops populated with authentic product offers and a suite of 91 cross-shop tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of WebMall is to evaluate and facilitate advancements in web agents' navigation, reasoning, and efficiency within e-commerce scenarios.

data.source: Four simulated online shops populated with authentic product offers sourced from the Common Crawl.
data.annotation: Manual selection and distribution of product offers across the shops.

methods: Baseline evaluation of eight agent configurations
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the results of the agents performing tasks, including aggregations across completed tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher completion rates and F1 scores indicate better performance and efficiency of web agents.
methodology.baseline_results: The best configuration achieved a completion rate of 75% and an F1 score of 87% for basic tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation performed through baseline experiments with varying agent configurations.
